intro: Ochrocarpos neurophyllus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed ochrocarpus, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its leaves are narrow and often have a distinct, waxy coating that helps reduce water loss. Ochrocarpos neurophyllus is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
